snippet: The departure of Peter Ragone, the powerful steward of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s public image, is the most significant shake-up yet at a close-knit City Hall.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's senior adviser Peter Ragone is leaving post, and will be replaced by press secretary Phil Walzak; Ragone has been instrumental in helping craft de Blasio's public image, as well as responses to crises in tumultuous first year in office.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM
byline.contributor: Alexander Burns and Nikita Stewart contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The departure of Peter Ragone, the powerful steward of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s public image, is the most significant shake-up yet at a close-knit City Hall.

headline.main: A Top Aide Who Helped Mold de Blasio’s Public Image Is Leaving
headline.print_headline: A Top Aide Who Helped Mold de Blasio’s Public Image Is Leaving
